results.title: The Initial interview
results.brief_description: A marriage counselling session is presented, showing the initial interview. Afterwards a class of marriage counsellors are taught by flashbacks highlighting important moments of the interview. Role playing is introduced to mitigate the problems and fears of counsellors; interaction promotes emotional involvement of student counsellors.

results.title: Inheriting your physical traits
results.brief_description: Traces the inheritance of traits such as sex, eye colour, height and weight, showing the role of chromosomes and genes in determining their development. Shows the effect of dominant and recessive genes, and the results of the blending of the two.

results.title: The Informative label
results.brief_description: An explanation of how manufacturers test their products and assign ‘facts labels’ giving points to various qualities eg. durability, colour fastness. This enables consumers to compare directly the wares of different manufacturers.

results.title: The Information machine: or creative man and the data...
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames and IBM
results.brief_description: Made for the IBM pavilion at the Brussels World’s Fair, it attempts to clearly place the electronic computer in the context of human development, suggesting that it is a logical extension of our desire to connect and relate things. Explains the nature of data processing, beginning with primitive man and ending with the advent of machine simulation. Drawings and animation by Dolores Cannata, music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: Infinite journey
results.brief_description: Man’s historical aspiration to reach the moon and the world’s involvement in the Apollo 11 flight are the themes of this film, which are placed in the context of the historical aspiration and scientific genius of many lands which made them possible. Also focuses on the Gemini flights. Introduced by Richard Nixon and narrated by Gregory Peck.

results.title: Infectious diseases and natural body defenses
results.brief_description: Uses photomicrography, laboratory demonstration, and animation to illustrate the two groups of natural body defences which guard the body against disease. Explains the outer body defences including the skin, passages of the nose and throat, and stomach acids. Among the inner body defences are lymph glands, the chemical antibodies, spleen, liver and while blood cells.

results.title: Infant development in the kibbutz (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines infant behaviour under the kibbutz system of shared parental and group care. Shows activities of the “baby house” where babies ranging from newborn to 21 months old are cared for while their parents are at work.

results.title: Infant dance (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Wolverhampton Education Committee
results.brief_description: A class of 6-7 year olds is observed performing spontaneous dance movements, movements inspired by suggestions from the teacher, and by short rhythms played on percussion instruments. Individual children are studied in closer detail.

results.title: The Industrious flame
results.creator_credit: John Miller, Frank Green, Ace Films and British Gas Council
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that heat is essential in practically all industries to process raw materials. States that gas is one of the most economical sources of heat and shows its use in the pottery, steel sheet, baking and electric globes industries.
